Definition.Description: CHR Hansen created golden profiles in Seeq to proactively correct costly batch deviations . Golden Batch Profiles Identifying Deviations Solution Creating Context Using the available signals, build in the context to define the periods of interest. Data and Context Selecting Reference Data Select the best (golden) periods using any KPI(s)
Definition.Document:
Golden Profile Monitoring

Golden Batch Profiles Identifying Deviations

Solution

Creating Context

Using the available signals, build in the context to define the periods of interest. Data and Context

Selecting Reference Data

Select the best (golden) periods using any KPI(s) or by manual selection. Training operations

Create Statistical Limits

Build statistical limits using the training dataset. Build an upper, lower, and any other set of control limits as needed. Overlay Control Limits --> Swap Assets

Deviation Detection and Monitoring

Identify periods where the temperature deviate from the limits for more than three minutes. Send email notifications during a deviation event. Deviations --> Schedule Notification

Definition.DocumentBackup\u02c9B3BHbCR7txjEswHoBi2q:
Golden Profile Monitoring

Golden Batch Profiles Identifying Deviations

Deploy CPP golden profiles across assets and operations to detect real-time deviations and take corrective actions. 

  • Rapid deployment and iterations 
    • Save hours to days in model building
  • Real-time insights
    • Reduce time to action by hour or days to prevent costly deviations or quality losses

Challenge

Golden profiles are a critical tool in assessing process performance and detecting early signs of trouble. Combining disparate datasources and building the profiles at scale can prove to be a challenge.

Solution

Leverage Seeq to combine datasources and build and deploy golden profiles ad-hoc.  Visualize and monitor how well a process is remaining within historical norms. 

Creating Context

Using the available signals, build in the context to define the periods of interest. 

  • Data and Context

Selecting Reference Data

Select the best (golden) periods using any KPI(s) or by manual selection.

  • Training operations

Create Statistical Limits

Build statistical limits using the training dataset. Build an upper, lower, and any other set of control limits as needed.

  • Overlay Control Limits --> Swap Assets

Deviation Detection and Monitoring

Identify periods where the temperature deviate from the limits for more than three minutes. Send email notifications during a deviation event. 

  • Deviations --> Schedule Notification

Golden Profiles

Deploy CPP golden profiles across assets and operations to detect real-time deviations and take corrective actions. 

  • Rapid deployment and iterations 
    • Save hours to days in model building
  • Real-time insights
    • Reduce time to action by hour or days to prevent costly deviations or quality losses

Challenge

Golden profiles are a critical tool in assessing process performance and detecting early signs of trouble. Combining disparate datasources and building the profiles at scale can prove to be a challenge.

Solution

Leverage Seeq to combine datasources and build and deploy golden profiles ad-hoc.  Visualize and monitor how well a process is remaining within historical norms. 

Creating Context

Using the available signals, build in the context to define the periods of interest. 

  • Start with Data and Context

Selecting Reference Data

Select the best (golden) periods using any KPI(s) or by manual selection. **add note on potency**

  • Training operations

Create Statistical Limits

Build statistical limits using the training dataset. Build an upper, lower, and any other set of control limits as needed.

  • Overlay Profiles

Deviation Detection and Monitoring

Identify periods where the temperature deviate from the limits for more than three minutes. Send email notifications during a deviation event. 

  • Deviations  --> Schedule Notification

Golden Profile Scaling

Scale across assets, products, phases, and signals depending on process. 

  • Scaled  --> Swap
  • Treemap
